triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Provides the theoretical foundation for developing control methods for multiagent systems.

triples.name: Nonlinear system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control of uncertain nonlinear multiagent systems with complex dynamics.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The core problem domain involves controlling multiple interacting agents in formation.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: Adaptive fuzzy control technology is used to handle uncertain and time-varying system parameters.

triples.name: Fuzzy control system
triples.relevance: Fuzzy logic-based control techniques are applied to handle uncertainty in the nonlinear multiagent system.

triples.name: Event-driven architecture
triples.relevance: Event-triggered control principles are used to reduce communication resources while maintaining control performance.

triples.name: Actuator
triples.relevance: The paper addresses time-varying failures in actuators, a key component of control systems.

triples.name: Convergence analysis
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a fixed-time convergence approach for formation control with provable convergence guarantees.

triples.name: Event-triggered control
triples.relevance: A periodic adaptive event-triggered control scheme is proposed that reduces communication resources while maintaining control performance.
